column1: Relative volume of complaints per sector per 100,000 customers: Q4 2010 - Q4 2019, by quarter

Note: The pay-monthly mobile industry average from Q4 2019 should not be compared with the industry average prior to Q4 2019. This follows a methodological data improvement, made in agreement with Ofcom, to how Vodafone records consumer and business tariff subscribers.

Fixed line complaints per 100,000 customers/connections: Q4 2010 - Q4 2019, by quarter

Note: For Q4 2019 the actual measurable difference between the following landline provider’s number of complaints per 100,000 customers was less than one and so their results should be considered comparable: 1. TalkTalk and Vodafone; 2. Virgin Media and Post Office; 3. EE and Sky

Pay monthly' Mobile telephony complaints per 100,000 customers/connections, January 2013 - December 2019, by month

Note: Vodafone pay-monthly mobile complaints volumes and the industry average from October 2019 should not be compared with Vodafone pay-monthly complaints volumes and the industry average prior to October 2019. This follows a methodological data improvement made in agreement with Ofcom, to how Vodafone records consumer and business tariff subscribers.
Pay monthly' mobile telephony complaints per 100,000 customers/connections: Q1 2013 - Q4 2019, by quarter

Note: Vodafone pay-monthly mobile complaints volumes and the industry average from Q4 2019 should not be compared with Vodafone pay-monthly complaints volumes and the industry average prior to Q4 2019. This follows a methodological data improvement made in agreement with Ofcom, to how Vodafone records consumer and business tariff subscribers.

For Q4 2019 the actual measurable difference between the following pay-monthly mobile provider’s number of complaints per 100,000 customers was less than one and so their results should be considered comparable: 1. Three, Virgin Mobile and BT; 2. iD Mobile, EE, O2 and Sky Mobile; 3. EE, O2, Sky Mobile, and Tesco Mobile.
Pay TV complaints per 100,000 customers/connections, October 2011 - December 2019, by month
Pay TV complaints per 100,000 customers/connections: Q4 2011 - Q4 2019, by quarter
Note: For Q4 2019 the actual measurable difference between TalkTalk and BT's pay TV complaints per 100,000 customers was less than one and so their results should be considered comparable.

Sky pay TV complaints volumes and the industry average prior to Q2 2018 should no longer be considered comparable to those from Q2 2018. Following a refinement to the calculation methodology in November 2019, comparisons between the Q1 2016 pay TV industry average and Virgin Media's position are no longer reliable.
